TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed RegexOptions extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Provides enumerated values to use to set regular expression options.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Ein <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions> Wert kann als Parameter angegeben werden, um die folgenden Member der <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex> Klasse:
- Die <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex.%23ctor%28System.String%2CSystem.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions%29?displayProperty=nameWithType> Klassenkonstruktor.
- Die <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex.Split%28System.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions%29?displayProperty=nameWithType>-Methode.
- Die <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex.IsMatch%28System.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions%29?displayProperty=nameWithType>-Methode.
- Die <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex.Match%28System.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions%29?displayProperty=nameWithType>-Methode.
- Die <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex.Matches%28System.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions%29?displayProperty=nameWithType>-Methode.
- Die <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex.Replace%28System.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions%29?displayProperty=nameWithType> und <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex.Replace%28System.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.Text.RegularExpressions.MatchEvaluator%2CSystem.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions%29?displayProperty=nameWithType> Methoden.
Ein <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions> kann auch angegeben werden, als Parameter an die <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexCompilationInfo.%23ctor%2A> Konstruktor, oder er kann direkt zugewiesen werden die <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexCompilationInfo.Options%2A> Eigenschaft. Das resultierende <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexCompilationInfo> Objekt wird dann verwendet, im Aufruf der <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex.CompileToAssembly%2A> Methode.
Mehrere Optionen zur Verfügung gestellt, von einem Mitglied der <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions> Enumeration (insbesondere von Membern ExplicitCapture, IgnoreCase mehrzeiligen und Singleline) kann stattdessen mithilfe eines Zeichens Inline im Muster regulären Ausdrucks angegeben werden. Weitere Informationen finden Sie unter [Optionen für reguläre Ausdrücke](~/docs/standard/base-types/regular-expression-options.md).
## Examples Das folgende Beispiel definiert zwei reguläre Ausdrücken, die wiederholte Wörter im Text identifiziert, aber instanziiert werden mit anderen <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions.ExplicitCapture?displayProperty=nameWithType> Werte. Der erste reguläre Ausdruck wird die Groß-/Kleinschreibung; Groß-/Kleinschreibung wird ignoriert, wenn bestimmt wird, ob ein Wort mit dem vorherigen Wort identisch ist. Der zweite reguläre Ausdruck wird die Groß-/Kleinschreibung beachtet; ein Wort muss die Groß-/Kleinschreibung des vorherigen Worts genau werden dann als Duplikat betrachtet übereinstimmen.
[!code-csharp[System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions/cs/RegexOptions.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions/vb/RegexOptions.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions Compiled = int32(8)
Compiled = 8

Docs.summary: Specifies that the regular expression is compiled to an assembly. This yields faster execution but increases startup time. This value should not be assigned to the property when calling the method. For more information, see the "Compiled Regular Expressions" section in the [Regular Expression Options](~/docs/standard/base-types/regular-expression-options.md) topic.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions CultureInvariant = int32(512)
CultureInvariant = 512

Docs.summary: Specifies that cultural differences in language is ignored. For more information, see the "Comparison Using the Invariant Culture" section in the [Regular Expression Options](~/docs/standard/base-types/regular-expression-options.md) topic.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions ECMAScript = int32(256)
ECMAScript = 256

Docs.summary: Enables ECMAScript-compliant behavior for the expression. This value can be used only in conjunction with the , , and values. The use of this value with any other values results in an exception. For more information on the option, see the "ECMAScript Matching Behavior" section in the [Regular Expression Options](~/docs/standard/base-types/regular-expression-options.md) topic.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions ExplicitCapture = int32(4)
ExplicitCapture = 4

Docs.summary: Specifies that the only valid captures are explicitly named or numbered groups of the form (?<name>…). This allows unnamed parentheses to act as noncapturing groups without the syntactic clumsiness of the expression (?:…). For more information, see the "Explicit Captures Only" section in the [Regular Expression Options](~/docs/standard/base-types/regular-expression-options.md) topic.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions IgnoreCase = int32(1)
IgnoreCase = 1

Docs.summary: Specifies case-insensitive matching. For more information, see the "Case-Insensitive Matching " section in the [Regular Expression Options](~/docs/standard/base-types/regular-expression-options.md) topic.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions IgnorePatternWhitespace = int32(32)
IgnorePatternWhitespace = 32

Docs.summary: Eliminates unescaped white space from the pattern and enables comments marked with #. However, this value does not affect or eliminate white space in [character classes](~/docs/standard/base-types/character-classes-in-regular-expressions.md), numeric [quantifiers](~/docs/standard/base-types/quantifiers-in-regular-expressions.md), or tokens that mark the beginning of individual [regular expression language elements](~/docs/standard/base-types/regular-expression-language-quick-reference.md). For more information, see the "Ignore White Space" section of the [Regular Expression Options](~/docs/standard/base-types/regular-expression-options.md) topic.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions Multiline = int32(2)
Multiline = 2

Docs.summary: Multiline mode. Changes the meaning of ^ and $ so they match at the beginning and end, respectively, of any line, and not just the beginning and end of the entire string. For more information, see the "Multiline Mode" section in the [Regular Expression Options](~/docs/standard/base-types/regular-expression-options.md) topic.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions None = int32(0)
None = 0

Docs.summary: Specifies that no options are set. For more information about the default behavior of the regular expression engine, see the "Default Options" section in the [Regular Expression Options](~/docs/standard/base-types/regular-expression-options.md) topic.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions RightToLeft = int32(64)
RightToLeft = 64

Docs.summary: Specifies that the search will be from right to left instead of from left to right. For more information, see the "Right-to-Left Mode" section in the [Regular Expression Options](~/docs/standard/base-types/regular-expression-options.md) topic.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions Singleline = int32(16)
Singleline = 16

Docs.summary: Specifies single-line mode. Changes the meaning of the dot (.) so it matches every character (instead of every character except \n). For more information, see the "Single-line Mode" section in the [Regular Expression Options](~/docs/standard/base-types/regular-expression-options.md) topic.
